bib_record.title: Charged photoparticles from the O-18 giant resonance.

free_txt: Direct measurement    of    energy    and     angular
spectra  were   converted   to   excitation   energy
by the bremsstrahlung spectrum.  In order to  obtain
the  a-i/a-0  coefficients the angular distributions
were then  fitted  with  an  expansion  of  legendre
The measured  particle  spectra  were  corrected  for
energy loss in the target gas and the Havar foils of
Emission of charged photoparticles from  O-18  giant
resonance  region was investigated at the university
of giessen electron linac at bremsstrahlung endpoint
energies  of  24  and  32  MeV.  Spectra of protons,
measured  at  six angles.  Proton decay shows strong
transitions to excited states in N-17. Deuterons and
tritons    have    a    nearly   isotropic   angular
O-18(g,a-0)C-14 cross sections are determined in the
giant E1 resonance region. E1 and E2 O-18(g,a-0)C-14
cross   sections   are   derived  from  the  angular
A gas target was used.  The target  was  filled  with
O-18  gas at pressure of 450 and 700 mbar during the
24 and 32 MeV runs,  Respectively.  the  target  was
The data have been digitized in USA LLNL  and
obtained by CDFE in the form of data tables.
